TopicTitle: Landing legs only go down one at a time. Help as I'd like all 3 to extended at once.

Articles.Content:
I don't know what happened between my last .22 build vs. this .23 one with more mods. When I'm falling back to Kerbin and on the parachute, I have 3 lander legs for my tall rocket. When I right click a lander leg, only one extends at a time instead of all 3 like before. How can I fix this?

Thanks for the help!

Edited February 6, 2014 by jpinard
Click the green button just to the right of your altimeter.

That means the symmetry got lost between game version. Replace them with new symmetry placed legs in VAB. Although it might be a new feature.

Curious - why do You use right click menu to extend the legs instead of using a button?

An alternative to this is to use an action group to toggle them. However, as pointed out above, you need to ensure that they are joined by symmetry first; otherwise you'd make sure to select them all while assigning actions.
I think G extends/ opposite of extends all of the landing legs on a ship?

That means the symmetry got lost between game version. Replace them with new symmetry placed legs in VAB. Although it might be a new feature.

If you right-click legs you can extend/retract them individually (useful if you're landing on a steep slope or trying to right a flipped over craft)

But yeah, press the G key or the green button at the top menu to toggle all the legs at the same time.

Wow, I had no idea about the gear button. I thought that was just for wheels on airplanes. Learn something new everyday. Thanks all!

BTW - I did have them all placed via symmetry so I was basically doing it the hard way.
